headline: Pineapple Stuffing
description: Pineapple stuffing made with crushed pineapple and bread cubes makes for a sweet and scrumptious side dish to serve with ham or on the holiday table.
name: Pineapple Stuffing

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch baking pan.

Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in pineapple and bread cubes; transfer mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Let it sit a few minutes to firm up before serving.

review.reviewBody: The recipe is very good, my family loved it. I doubled it and made one change. I used 5 slices of white bread and 5 slices of maple and brown sugar bread.

This is so good. Whenever I get together with my family or in-laws, I'm always asked to make it. It's like a dessert with dinner. Some may find it a tad to sweet. If this is the case just decrease sugar amount. It's also best to use bread that's a few days old (it's easier to cut in). When I make it, I always make a double batch regardless of how many people as most go back for more.

Everyone loved it! I used Keto Bread and 1/2 cup lite brown sugar and 1/2 cup monk fruit sweetener. Next time I will really let the butter soften. And I used the crushed pineapple and added half can of chunk pineapple. Very, very good!

I make this stuffing per the recipe. Always in demand on Thanksgiving! It is definitely sweet but my family and friends love it as is! My mom had the same recipe and it was always a fave growing up! Thank you Allrecipes for having this recipe available as I misplaced my mom’s. ❤️

I’ve been making this recipe for years and everyone enjoys it. For the bread, I use 6 slices of Italian bread because it holds up better than regular white bread. Once the egg and sugar mixture is well beaten, stir in the drained pineapple and then gently fold in the bread cubes. If using a glass baking dish, remember to lower the oven temperature by 25 degrees. Enjoy!
This recipe is great but I cut the sugar from 1 cup to a 1/2 C .... One time I made it omitting the sugar completely and no one even noticed !
I used brown sugar instead of white but that was the only change. This stuffing is so good, it's almost a dessert!
This is a great side dish. I made this to take to a covered dish dinner and it was a hit. There was nothing left over to take home. I am grateful for the Allrecipes website!! Thank you!
I made it to go with the leftover New Year's ham. It was a big hit.

So good, it's almost like a dessert. And that was after I cut the sugar by half! I used brown sugar instead of white and just one-half cup, and with the pineapple chunks, it had just the perfect level of sweetness to complement our ham. Super easy to make, too. I will be finding excuses to make it often!

The perfect accompaniment to ham. I cut the sugar back to 3/4 cup and it was still too sweet for us. I also left my bread cubes out to dry overnight like traditional stuffing. Drying them left the dish a tad dry, but held its shape nicely. I think when I make it again, I will cut sugar to 1/2 cup (maybe try brown sugar) and add some reserved pineapple juice to help moisten the stuffing as well as bump up that zing that pineapple leaves in your mouth.

I just made this for Christmas dinner with my ham. I doubled the recipe using a small loaf of Hawaiian bread, 1-20z can crushed pineapple, 1-20z can of tidbit pineapple and I followed some others' advice to cut the sugar in half. I used 1/2 c brown sugar and 1/2 c white sugar. It was a HUGE hit especially with my grandkids, who can be picky eaters. I will definitely make this again!

I use this recipe with a splash of vanilla extract- everyone raves about my pineapple stuffing. Make sure that when you cream the butter and sugar that you mix until the mixture gets lighter in color and almost doubles in size. I use a stand mixer on 4 setting for about 5 mins to get the correct consistency. Properly creaming the butter and sugar will give a better taste, texture and coverage.
The family and I loved it. Thank you.
So easy going great with my Easter ham. Making ahead is even easier.
Family loves this, always a hit and something different.
This recipe goes great with ham, all I changed was I added a bit of the pineapple juice
This is my go to whenever we have ham. It’s almost like having dessert with dinner!
I used 1/2 cup of sugar, the crushed pineapple with the juice, 7 or 8 slices cube bread. I sprinkled cinnamon sugar on top before baking. It was delicious! I will definitely make it again.
Family loved it, and so east to make
Thought this was good just the way it was

I make this several times a year. My family loves it and there's never any left over. Make sure you're using pineapple that's canned in juice, not heavy syrup. Heavy syrup is sickening sweet and will ruin this dish, IMO.
Delicious stuffing recipe! I made this recipe for New Year's and everyone loved it. As suggested by other reviewers, I used only 1/2 cup sugar and increased the crushed pineapple for greater flavor.
Yummy. I will try it again with a double recipe.
I first had this when an old boyfriend’s mom made it for one holiday and I fell in LOVE with it! Absolutely love the fact that it was on All recipes because it made my life simple!
Definitely NOT 1 hour cook time, I put it in the over at 300 for 50 minutes and it came out a bit burned but other than that it was good

I doubled the wet ingredients, using 1/2 c white and 1/2 c brown sugar, and used 1 bag unseasoned white breadcrumbs. It fit perfectly into in a 9X13 pan. Sprinkled pumpkin pie spice on top and it turned out great!

Been making this for EVER. I use butter, regular salted butter. And I have switched to pineapple tidbits. I like to see and taste the pineapple. It is always eaten or taken home. Sometimes I save a little and hide it so I have some for the next day. I bake it ahead in a glass dish and reheat in microwave. Perfect.

This recipe is always a hit!. It is so easy to prepare. Like all cooks I made a slight modification. I make a flour, butter, brown sugar crumble for the top. Who doesn't like crumble. This is a must for all holidays.
Have made this many times, and everyone enjoys it!

I've been making this for years. I cut the sugar by 1/3 and add about 5 slices of cinnamon swirl bread cubed and do a split of half crushed pineapple and half pineapple tidbits. By doubling the bread you get a firmer mixture that's more like bread pudding. We eat it hot or cold and can be served as a desert!
This is a bread pudding in my experience. Delicious and simple to make. I used fresh crushed pineapple and the flavor was that much better. Highly recommend.
I added some pie spices as suggested, & dotted the butter on top. It was too sweet, so I will cut down the sugar in half next time. I will definitely make this again. Served it with ham...very good!

I made this on a whim to add something new to our Thanksgiving dinner. My sister was skeptical so she made traditional stuffing as well. 

All of the stuffing I made (this recipe) was GONE in a matter of minutes. The kids were asking for MORE of just the stuffing. 

This will be a staple for all our holiday gatherings going forward.

Simple and delicious. We paired this with ham as suggested by other reviewers and my husband and I really enjoyed it. Unfortunately, the amount of sugar involved will keep it out of our regular rotation, but it's a nice treat maybe on a holiday.

Family favorite!! Always make at least a double batch, always fabulous made exactly as recipe dictates! Have also made using potato bread, brioche and hawaiian bread rolls...not together but that would probably be yummy as well ;)
I have made this a lot and everyone loves it! You can’t eat a lot because it’s sweet but it’s delicious!
Awesome recipe! I had all ingredients in my kitchen and it took less than 5 minutes to put together. Everyone loved it and it was something new.

This recipe is outstanding. I've made it a number of times already during the holidays and it absolutely disappears. As others have suggested, my changes are that I use real butter, 1.25 melted sticks; 5 eggs; 9 pieces of white bread, cubed; .25 cup of white sugar, .25 cup of brown sugar; sprinkle in some pumpkin spice; when pouring into greased pan, sprinkle a little more pumpkin spice on top. Then bake half hour with tin foil cover; then, half hour without. DELISH !!!

I’ve been making this dish for Easter & Christmas for years now. It is a family favorite. The only thing I do differently is, I double the amount of bread it calls for. I use at least 10 slices & I always use 20oz can. I usually have to double the recipe tho, everyone Lo
Pineapple Stuffing. A sweet and savory side dish that's a twist on classic stuffing. It's perfect served with ham and pork dishes.
Incredibly easy and super-delicious recipe! I make this every holiday! Thank you!
I also added cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, allspice. Used fresh pineapple. People really liked it.

I make this literally every year for my family and it’s phenomenal. The only change I make is using way more bread. I use about 12-15 slices of bread instead of 5 to give it the right consistency. It’s always a crowd pleaser when I make it.
Super easy and came out great!
Quick, easy and delicious.............what more can you ask for? Family requested it again this Thanksgiving.
This is an old family recipe. Very good even with turkey. Definitely five stars!

I served it with a baked ham. It did not go over well with my guests, but I liked it. Most of it, I threw out. I rate at four stars, because it tasted good. I realize that this review is conflicting, but I liked it, I ate it. Sometimes a successful recipe is about correctly reading the guests to whom you serve it. Enough said.
Made this for a group of 90 people, it was a hit! I did take the advice of some reviewers to use half the sugar and I was glad I did.

I bless the day I came upon this recipe. Can't do ham without it!! Recently I finally decided to alter to create more a Pina colada taste. I already had coconut extract so I added few drops (probably 1/8-1/4 tsp) and OMG!!! It was soooo good. Try it! Cinnamon on top also helps with a beautiful color as well . BON APPETIT!!
Great base except I always double and use real unsalted butter and instead of all pineapple I do half pineapple half mandarin oranges. Always a hit!

Doubled the recipe for Easter dinner using 1 can crushed and 1 can chunk pineapple. OMG everyone went crazy for this and I printed out 4 copies of this recipe. Also used 1/2 C white and 1/2 C brown sugar as suggested. I served it along with slow cooker ham, from this site, potato salad, baked beans and deviled eggs and a loaf of challah bread. Excellent dinner and excellent recipe!

I made this for Easter dinner and it serves as a nice side to ham. I doubled the recipe and used only 1/2 cup each of brown and white sugar. I will make again, but will use less sugar. I'm sure 1/2- 3/4 cups of sugar would be sufficient.
My husband goes insane over this stuffing. I use Kings Hawaiian bread, it's like you're eating dessert

This makes a small amount so to make it 9x13 for 10-12 people with the right amount of sweetness I do this: 2 sticks butter at room temp, 3/4 cup white sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 8 eggs, 2 20oz can crushed pineapple in juice drained, 1 20oz can chunky pineapple in juice drained, 10 slices thick/hearty white bread cubed. Follow directions. Sprinkle cinnamon on top. Bake 30 min covered, 30 min uncovered. Let sit 20 min to firm up. Watch it ALL disappear.

Great recipe for a ham accompaniment. I did cut the sugar in half and it was PLENTY sweet. Also, I made it twice, once with crushed and once with chunk pineapple. Definitely crushed was better because it permeated the dish more completely. Will only use crushed in the future. Lots of raves and compliments from the extended fam on Christmas Eve.

Very tasty and super easy. As others suggested, I halved the amount of sugar and did 1/4 C brown sugar and 1/4 C white sugar. It'd be way too sweet with one cup of sugar. Had a can of pineapple chunks so I rough chopped them and they were fine. I used egg whites too. Covered it for the first half of bake and then uncovered to brown it a bit on top. I'll absolutely make it again. Everyone loved it with their Christmas ham.
Excellent! Made this with Thanksgiving dinner and it was a big hit. Very simple with few ingredients. I made it with leftover hotdog rolls. This recipe is now in my favorites!
My daughter-in-law makes this & the whole family fights over it. She also doubles the recipe!! So good!
I used a little less sugar because I didn’t want it so sweet. Other than that, it was delicious,
This is the reason i will never get in better shape, and im ok with that. Love
added more bread and it was delicious
Husband enjoyed. Not my fav

I made this for our Easter dinner and it went perfectly with the ham. After reading the reviews, I used half the sugar since it sounded like it didn't need it and it was still plenty sweet. I also used six pieces of bread instead of the five that it called for. I doubled the recipe and it fit perfectly in a 9x13 pan. Great recipe!
This recipe is wonderful. I used slightly less sugar and it turned out great. I loved it; my family loved it. They couldn't get enough

I made this for Christmas Eve dinner. It is absolutely delicious with ham. I made a double batch, and doubled all the ingredients with the exception of the sugar. I kept the sugar at 1 cup. My family raved about the dish! This will be my go-to side dish with ham. The reason I'm giving it 3 stars is because it would have been way too sweet with the full amount of sugar as directed in the recipe. I may even reduce the sugar content even further the next time I make it. I also used a 20 oz. can of crushed pineapple and a 20 oz. can of pineapple tidbits as suggested by another reviewer. That gave it a good texture.

Made this after trying to find new sides for ham. Easy and delicious! My husband loved it! Will def make again, and perhaps try adding cinnamon as some suggested and maybe some coconut? Thanks for sharing!
Will definitely make this again! Really went well with our Christmas ham. I did cut the sugar in half and it was perfect! Thank you for a keeper!
Quick, easy and very tasty. . Will make this again.

I made this for they family Christmas. Everyone loved it. I did make a double Batch and used a can of crushed pineapple and a can of chunked pineapple. I mixed it the night before and baked it in the morning. That was something my mom always did with her stuffing she said it helped the stuffing set better.
Loved it, the liquid does absorb back into the stuffing while sitting. Could double as a dessert. Used butter instead of margarine. Yum!

My husband makes this as a dessert for parties, and it's always a huge hit. We both agree that it's way too sweet to be a stuffing. He puts it on the dessert table labeled pineapple bread pudding, and it vanishes every time.

When your kids want ham for Thanksgiving and all you really care about is the stuffing----this is the happy compromise. It was ridiculously easy and very flavorful. I cut the sugar in half, as other reviewers recommended, and it was the perfect sweetness for most of us (one child thought it too sweet----but she doesn't like chocolate, so that throws her credibility out the window here...) I also used a bakery bread loaf which made for a thicker, more substantial bread bite. I kept thinking about what a fun and delicious bread pudding could be made from this recipe! We will definitely make this again. Thanks for sharing, BBHealy.

My favorite side dish now! I get asked to bring it to every holiday meal. I follow the review below and double the recipe below using 1 can crushed and 1 can chunks. Sprinkle both cinnamon sugar and pumpkin pie spice on top - so delicious!!
To convince my husband it is stuffing, what type of grave should i use with a smoked ham and this dressing!? I usually use smokey red eye made with coffee. You think it would be ok?
I have made this for several years for our family holidays dinners. Everyone who tries it is amazed at how good it is. Thanks for sharing this recipe. I love simply and good.
I made this and took it to work. Everyone loved it and they asked me to bring it again. Easy recipe and easy to make!

The first time I made it i followed the recipe exactly, it was way too sweet and nobody ate it.

The second time i used 3/4 cups of sugar and melted butter instead of margarine also i sprinkled cinnamon to top! also i used some vanilla extract...delicious!
1 cup of sugar was too sweet so I used 10 slices of bread instead of 5 to absorb the sugar. Perfect.
I combined several of the suggestion like adding onions to make it less like a dessert. I also cut down on the sugar. My family still found it too much like a bread pudding.
I've been making this for many years. I cut down on the sugar, used real butter and usually sprinkle cinnamon on top. I think I'll try the pumpkin spice next time. Always a family favorite!!!
Excellent and so easy! I make this every year now. Thank you!
I cut the sugar in half (or less) and add a small can of Ortega green chilies. Makes it more of a savory side, and less of a dessert. Also use butter instead of margarine.
easy to make and the family loves it...I add ham to it for extra flavor.
This is now a holiday staple in my house for the last 5+ years. It's requested by my quests and there are never any leftovers. I usually make two pans just so there's extra to go around!
Awesome taste made it twice and its gone in minutes.
I made a couple changes ( I know I hate me too sometimes :-) Used 1/2 brown sugar, and added dried cranberries and chopped pecans, it puts this recipe OVER THE TOP! Soooo good with ham! :-) :-) :-)

this recipe is awesome!! Its too sweet to serve as a stuffing for ham so I also doubled up on the recipe add cinnamon vanilla extract and a little nutmeg and serve it as a dessert. a definite crowd pleaser.

I absolutely love this dish. I make it for Easter every year. It goes great with ham. I also have made this using splenda and truvia for baking. I have used whole wheat bread and hawaiian bread. It is just sweet enough. I use real butter too. If it were'nt so full of calories I would make it much more.
This has become a requested dish for all holiday meals. It's quick and easy. I'm a fan of brown sugar, so I usually do half white/half brown sugar. Either way, it's great!
This is always a huge hit especially at Easter. HAs anyone ever made in advance and refrigerated overnight before cooking? Does it work out okay?
I have made this for years! You can make it the day before and microwave it on the day of your dinner.
This recipe was delicious! My family really enjoyed it and I'll be making it again!
Great side for ham. Served at Christmas dinner and was a huge hit. Didn't change a thing.
Try this recipe substituting raisin bread for white bread for a sweeter desert taste!

Super good--doubled the recipe, used one 20-oz can of crushed pineapple and one 20 oz can of pineapple chunks, and sprinkled cinnamon on top as other reviewers suggested. Barely a bit left, even the picky eaters loved this. I was afraid it would be too sweet (with both the sugar and pineapple), but it was just right. We had this with ham, and it was the perfect side. Will definitely be making this again.

Awesome recipe!! My family LOVES it! It goes great with ham. I reduce the sugar to half. I add cinnamon on the top before baking. I cover with foil for 45 mins and then take the foil off for 15 additional mins.
I tried this recipe at Thanksgiving 3 years ago and now it is the #1 requested item on the menu. Everyone loves it and it makes a great take along dish as well. Thanks for sharing!!

I made this recipe last year. Decided to make it again at Easter and again at Thanksgiving. I made a few changes! Intead of bread I crumbled Nilla wafers, and used very little sugar. This turned out like a pineapple souffle' and was delicious. Everyone just loved it. Will be making again this year!,
